page.title: 04St. Mary's Church past&pres.
page.content: St. Mary's Church, Goudhurst, stands on the highest point in the area, 127 metres above sea level. It is the oldest building in the village part dating back to the early 12C. There are some l5C brasses in the church. The tower is approximately 17 metres high and was re-built after the original one collapsed when the spire was struck by lightning in 1637. The spire was not added thus leaving a squat square tower. The bell chamber contains 8 bells, 7 trebles and 1 tenor. Most date from the 18C. From the tower which is often open to the public,one can see about 5l churches when visibility is good. The churchyard was the scene of gunfighting when the notorious Hawkhurst gang of smugglers was defeated by the villagers in l747.
